word: Especially dreadful is the thought of a child turning in hatred upon a mother who has become old and feeble, upon whom has come those infirmities of disposition attendant upon second childhood.  How patiently, how tenderly, should children bear with such a mother!  Tender words which will not irritate the spirit should be spoken.  A true Christian will never be unkind, never under any circumstances be neglectful of his father or mother, but will heed the command, "Honor thy father and thy mother."  God has said, "Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head, and honor the face of the old man." ...
